result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael G Crawford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael G Crawford not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Michael G Crawford.  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for an Bail Bond Hearing. Defendant has covid and was not produced for today's proceedings. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael G Crawford appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Michael G Crawford.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 16CF3510. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: South Milw Investigator - K. Walusay.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael G Crawford not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court in person for Michael G Crawford.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel needed back in trial and unable to proceed. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant.  (Michael G. Crawford, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court via video, defendant Michael G Crawford not in court, in custody at HOC.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Case adjourned due to the defendant being in the Covid Pod with limited video. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael G Crawford in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael G Crawford in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael G Crawford appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
